Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
The Summoner Job has a moderate learning curve that plateaus
after grasping it's basics, leaving encounter knowledge as your final stepping stone.
Lets start from the top. Your Carbuncle is a necessary conduit for your Summons.
Surging Tempest management and Inner Release windows/interaction.
Summon your Carbuncle.

You need only learn the most widely applicable opener for party/raid enhancement alignment.

offsetting Gnashing Fang (28.8s) and Sonic Break (57.6s) by using a single GCD.

Good effort.
Summoner is very straight forward. Mastery comes from knowing
when to use each Summon to avoid moving when you need to stand and cast.
Farewell Summoner.
Visit: https://saltedxiv.com/ for the best guides the community has to offer.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Always keep your Carbuncle close.
Next, Ruin III. Ruin III is your primary filler. As a level 90 Summoner you rarely
Ruin III is your primary filler. As a level 90 Summoner you will rarely cast
Ruin III in this state more than thrice a minute unless you've made a catastrophic error.
Still, we all make mistakes and it's better to cast something than fall apart.
Hypercharge, it reduces the recast timer or BOTH Gauss Round AND Ricochet by 15s!
Cast 3 Ruin III's for good measure, then we'll get straight into Summons.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Now for the fun part.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
See your Summoner Gauge? Notice how it has a Gem for each Primal?
Well everytime you Summon Bahamut it recharges all 3 of them.
Everytime you Summon Bahamut/Pheonix all 3 Primals will recharge instantly. They
also transform your Ruin III to Astral Impulse/Fountain of Fire, powerful instant Spells.
Let's kill two birds with one stone. Execute the following sequence.
execute our true target, a Wildfire Hypercharge window... including Chainsaw!

Action.TextAuraExpression: Try again Warrior.
Do not use Infuriate/Inner Chaos with Inner Release stacks.
Refresh Surging Tempest.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
The Warrior Job is simple but there are pitfalls some might overlook.
Specifically excessive Storm's Eye usage and
overlapping Inner Release with Infuriate/Inner Chaos.
In the following exercise you will become acquainted with
Surging Tempest, Inner Release and Infuriate/Inner Chaos.
Begin by completing the Storm's Eye combo.
Surging Tempest management and Inner Release windows/interaction.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
I will assist you along the way.
Enter "/rotationguide" to skip to rotation assistance.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Now that you understand the fundamentals of the Warrior Job you need
learn the most widely applicable opener and rotation for party/raid enhancement alignment.
Complete the Standard Opener and practice for at least 180s.
(Wait for recast timers if needed.)
offsetting Gnashing Fang (28.8s) and Sonic Break (57.6s) by using a single GCD.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
I willl assist you along they way.
When satisfied enter "/endguide" to exit this guide.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Good effort.
As you can see there there isn't much to worry about. To excel as a Warrior simply
save as much as you can for raid/party enhancements without overcapping charges and Gauge.
Farewell Warrior.
Visit: https://saltedxiv.com/ for the best guides the community has to offer.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Storm's Eye grants +30s of Surging Tempest, a 10% damage enhancement.
Inner Release also grants +10s of Surging Tempest but only if you're already under the effect.
This 10% damage enhancement is invaluable but Storm's Path grants us more Beast Gauge.
More Beast Gauge means more Fell Cleaves and each Fell Cleave reduces the recast of Infuriate.
That being said, simply refresh Surging Tempest with Storm's Eye under 20s.
All that being said, you simply refresh Surging Tempest with Storm's Eye under 20s.
Now I would like you to use Inner Release and Infuriate together.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.

Trigger.Name: Objective 2: Inner Chaos Gud, but Bad

Action.TextAuraExpression: Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Notice you've gained 3 enhancements related to these 2 Abilities. Unlike
Primal Rend, Inner Chaos transforms Fell Cleave and will consume a stack of Inner Release.
You will still be able to Inner Chaos and Fell Cleave the expected number of times but
your 3rd Fell Cleave will not be a guaranteed Critical Direct Hit, Inner Release Fell Cleave!
In summary; Never use Infuriate before or while you have Inner Release stacks.
Never use Infuritate above 50 Beast Gauge, since Infuriate grants 50 Beast Gauge.
will not be a guaranteed Critical Direct Hit, Inner Release Fell Cleave!
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Complete this example sequence to complete the Job Guide.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Do not use Infuriate/Inner Chaos with Inner Release stacks.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Well done Warrior.

It's hard to go wrong as the Warrior job so I thought
it best to explain the few major mistakes that can be made.
Moving forward there's little else to say.

Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
The Machinist Job can seem quite daunting, with many
moving parts parts but it's all fast hands and muscle memory.
I'll cut right to the chase. Hypercharge is what
gets most Machinists tied up so we'll aim straight for the head.
Use Barrel Stabilizer to instantly gain 50 Heat (you can also use "Heated" Weaponskills).
Surging Tempest management and Inner Release windows/interaction.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
I will assist you along the way.

Now that you understand the fundamentals of the Machinist Job you need
only learn the most widely applicable opener and rotation for party/raid enhancement alignment.
My only advice is keeping Chain Saw, Air Anchor
and Drill on recast, even if they do not align with Hypercharge.
Complete the Standard Opener and practice for at least 180s.
(Wait for recast timers if needed.)
offsetting Gnashing Fang (28.8s) and Sonic Break (57.6s) by using a single GCD.

As you can see the Machinist Job is simple but requires quick hands and muscle memory.
simply avoiding your charge caps, gauge limits and executing full Hypercharge and Wildfire windows is a close second.
What I've instructed ensures you always deal maximum damage under raid/party enhancements.
Avoiding charge caps, Gauge limits and executing full Wildfires and Hypercharges is also viable.
Farewell Machinist.
Visit: https://saltedxiv.com/ for the best guides the community has to offer.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
You need at least 50 Heat Gauge to enter Hypercharge. While Hypercharge increases the potency
of ANY single target Weaponskill by 20, we will almost always use Heat Blast in it's duration.
Heat Blast not only has a 1.5s GCD, allowing us to land 5 Heat Blasts during
Hypercharge, it reduces the recast timer of BOTH Gauss Round AND Ricochet by 15s.
This is where we hone your fast draw.
Hypercharge, it reduces the recast timer or BOTH Gauss Round AND Ricochet by 15s!
Complete the sequence above before Hypercharge ends.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Good work.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Now that you are familiar with Hypercharge windows I want you to
attempt a Wildfire Hypercharge window including Chain Saw for good measure.
Wildfire, like Hypercharge adds potency to each Weaponskill in it's duration.
A whopping 150 potency to be exact and lasts long enough to enhance a 6th Weaponskill.
In the following exercise we will combine Wildfire's 150 potency and 10s duration
with Hypercharge's rapid Heat Blast Weaponskills and 20 potency for massive damage.
Complete the sequence above before Wildfire explodes.
execute our true target, a Wildfire Hypercharge window... including Chainsaw!

Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Last but not least, the Battery Gauge. The Battery Gauge is used to summon the
Automoton Queen. The Queen will execute a series of attacks followed by 600+ potency abilities.
The more Battery Gauge you have when you summon her the more damage her final abilites will deal.
Ideally you want to summon her so her high potency attacks will land within party/raid enhancements.
That being said her total potency is linear. Summoning her twice at 50 = summoning her once at 100.
Ideally you want to summon her so her high potency attacks will land within party/raid enhancements.
Summon the Automaton Queen to compelte the Job Guide.
abilities will deal. Ideally you want to summon her when the Batter Gauge is at 90 or 100.
